title: What is your favourite rock song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A. My favourite rock songs? Oh my, it's an impossibly long list. The greatest rock songs started with Chuck Berry, Fats Domino, and Bill Haley, then through Chubby Checker, Elvis Presley, Buddy Holly, then the Beatles, the Stones, through to Pink Floyd, AC/DC, KISS, David Bowie, Aerosmith, Alice Cooper, Queen, Joan Jett, the Ramones, Iggy Pop/Stooges, the Clash, all the way through to today. My list would be hundreds of songs long. Even if I just listed my favourite Beatles songs, I'd still be looking at dozens. Let's label the Beatles, Elvis, Berry, Haley, Domino, and the Stones as essential listening and then put them aside. That's Rock 101 right there. With the above excluded, what I will do is just list what songs are most often on my MP3 player at any given time. The Ramones: Blitzkrieg Bop, Rockaway Beach, Rock and Roll High School, Sheena is a Punk Rocker, Touring, Judy is a Punk, Oh Oh I Love Her So, All is Quiet on the Eastern Front, Come on Now, Rock and Roll Radio, Somebody Like Me, My My Kind of a Girl, Outsider, No Go, Howling at the Moon, Bonzo Goes to Bitburg, Something to Believe In, Somebody Put Something in my Drink, I Believe in Miracles, and pet Sematary. That was just one band. Are you SURE you want the rest of them? Joan Jett: I Hate Myself for Loving You, Nag, Crimson and Clover, Bad Reputation, Do Ya Wanna Touch Me, and I Love Rock and Roll. Pink Floyd: Comfortably Numb, the entire "Dark Side of the Moon" and "Wish You Were here" albums, Another Brick in the Wall parts 1, 2 and 3, Echoes, Hey You, Run Like Hell, If, In the Flesh?, Mother, Goodbye Blue Sky, and One of These Days. So many others omitted due to lack of space. :-) Also: Elton Motello: Jet Boy Jet Girl, Tutti Frutti Alice.Tenpole Tudor: Her Fruit is Forbidden, One for the MasterAlice Cooper: School's Out, No More Mister Nice GuyQueen: Pretty much everything written by Freddie Mercury.Adam Ant (yes, the pop star did some rock songs): Vive le Rock, and this demo version of Manners and Physique which is done in a rockabilly style:  Sham69: If the Kids Are United, Borstal BreakoutStiff Little Fingers: Alternative UlsterCheap Trick: The entire Buddhokan album, Little Sister, Dream Police, The Flame, Don't be Cruel, and Voices. (Despite their fame, they're still underrated in my view.) Do the Beach Boys count? If so, then I have another dozen or so songs.

First things first, my favorite band is Rush. Always has been, always will be. But, narrowing things down to one song is a little easier said than done. There are a lot of songs that would be easy to list: Tom Sawyer, Subdivisions, YYZ, Spirit of Radio, etc. Don’t get me wrong, I love those songs. But, there are two that stand out head and shoulders above the rest to me. For very different reasons. Song 1 (not THE favorite): “The Wreckers”. This song is one of the final two due to lyrics. “All I know is that sometimes you have to be wary of a miracle too good to be true,All I know is that sometimes the truth is contrary everything in life you thought you knewAll I know is that sometimes you have to be wary, 'cause sometimes the target is you” But, when all is said and done, there can only be one song. “Far Cry”. Specifically, there is one point in the song that will send shivers up and down my spine every time I see/hear it. In the video, it occurs at 2:45. The drumroll leading into the pyro.

Since you are speaking of a genre that encompasses many different sounds, instruments, techniques and setups, to ask which rock song would be my favourite would become tricky to answer. Even when I answer this, I fear that it would be too vague to make much sense. Also, rock is one of my favourite music genres so I cannot really pick a favourite unless a concrete category was included. Anyway, here goes. Blackbird - Alter Bridge.  This song manages to capture the essence of rock music without claiming any identity that may hint at being alternative/indie. The lead vocals are soaring and the guitar solos are simply sublime. This band manages to capture the essence of hard rock while not sounding overblown, pomp and archaic. Also, this song deals with the passing of a loved one. This hits much closer to home as I had to deal with a few drug-related and gang-related deaths over the years. I was never the closest but the way it affected my peers, friends and community could never be ignored.

My absolute favorite rock song is without doubt Bullet the Blue Sky by U2. This song takes me places. It has so many facets, so much raw anger and it’s so beautifully poetic. It’s a very atypical U2 song, but in my opinion, one of their best. It’s from The Joshua Tree, the album that really launched U2. This song stands out like no other between all the other giants (With or Without You, Where The Streets Have No Name (also one of my all-time favorites), I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For). Especially the live versions are the best. 14 - U2 - Bullet the Blue Sky (ZOO TV - Sydney 1993) This one is is from the ZOO TV/Zooropa Tour. U2 - Bullet The Blue Sky | U2: iNNOCENCE + eXPERIENCE Live in Paris (2015) And finally this one is from their latest tour. Notice how different both versions are, both lovely. This song is so intense, it gives me goosebumps every time! Tell me how you feel about it!

My favourite rock song? It would probably be Poison by Alice Cooper, but it is very close between that, Welcome to The Jungle (Guns N’ Roses), Hells Bells (AC/DC), and Bohemian Rhapsody (Queen).. But also, I love so many songs from other artists as well, like Twisted Sister, KISS, and Mötley Crüe. Here is my playlist: Favourite, a playlist by rhettck02 on Spotify in case you are interested. And if you can’t tell, Alice Cooper is my favourite artist. Just ignore the Michael Jackson if you want, because I know his music isn’t classified as rock, but it’s too good to not mix with my favourite rock artists and songs.

My favorite rock songs are the ones that spur a memory and take me on a little trip. One of the first that comes to mind is from the first album I ever owned. Elton Johns “Captain Fantastic and the Brown Dirt Cowboy”. I've been telling my friends about how Elton John got me laid!! It was the early 80s I was a long haired serious metal head and helped a buddies older sis move with my pickup. Later that night after we were done she had me stay, we had drinks and she was totally blown away that I knew the lyrics to all the Elton. I think she saw the metal head and didn't think that I might be well rounded in my music tastes later that night we.... Well you get it. Another one is (this will make my wife happy) Queen. “We Will Rock You/ We Are the Champions) as soon as I hear that im 13 and hiking with the boyscouts (Im an Eagle Scout) in Southmountain park at night.

Nutshell , by Alice in chains is a great song. Its a little depressing because of the lyrics, it's about his addiction to drugs and his personal struggle with them. He eventually overdosed and died. It's a very honest and emotional song written from the heart. The gitaur work is amazing, truly great song writing. I love the songs that tool writes, pure genius. The musicianship is flawless, lyrics and vocals are incredible. Any songs Steve Earl writes are good, Gordon Downing lead singer and songwriter of the Tragically Hip,I love his stories and lyrics. I truly believe he's one of the best song writers ever.

I can never decide which one is my “favorite”, but here they are Diary of a Madman by Ozzy Osbourne - This song has one of the best intros, main riffs, and arrangements of metal music. Randy Rhoads is behind this beautiful song and, in my honest opinion, it was his best work Metropolis Pt. 1:The Miracle and the Sleeper by Dream Theater- 7 minutes of progressive rock/metal beauty. This has some of the greatest motifs and solo section I've ever heard. One Angry Dwarf and 200 Solemn Faces by Ben Folds Five - Sheer fun and musical joy. This song is a party and it amazes me how just a 3 piece can make so much noise! Save Me by Avenged Sevenfold - Great arrangements and incredible musicianship make for a beautiful tune and motifs from different song on their album “Nightmare”

Impossible question! I can't narrow it down to one. But since it says song, singular, I'll provide the first that comes to my mind as my favorite: Rose Tattoo by the Dropkick Murphys (DKM)  This completes the actual answer to the question. However.... Since today, 30 May 16 is Memorial Day, as a bonus, I'll offer readers links to Fields of Athenry by DKM, one of my favorite songs. The first link is the original. The second link is a ballad that DKM did for SGT Andrew Farrar, USMC, killed in Al Anbar Iraq in 2005. They played this ballad at his funeral and provided all proceeds from the sale of the single to SGT Farrar's familiarly.   One can also find a song called "Last Letters Hone" which DKM wrote as a tribute to SGT Farrar.

I’m terrible about picking my favorite anything. Yet despite my decades-long passion for Bruce Springsteen, I actually have a favorite song of his, which I’ve seen performed live 80+ times and listened to it countless times more. Which makes it my favorite rock song. Thunder Road, live in LA, 1985 (although any version will do)

Only Woman Bleed by Alice Cooper, ir's a song that safdly iscribes what millions of mentally, and physically, and Emotionally abused by their husbands, or lifelong boyfriend's inflict on them. This song hit home With me personally. Because my favorite aunt let mr live in her basement after I Left schools and got my first job. Her very large mean, and violent husband treated her that exact way ad described in the song, and I was way too little, and soft to di anything a bout it, or try to stipulated him.

Tool - Lateralus This epic masterpiece based on the mathematical spiral the fibbonachi spiral is amazing. It has been rumoured the entire song is an entire mathematical piece of music, each vocal, each timing of the instrument is deliberately lart of a bigger picture. Following the will and wind we may just go where no-ones been. We'll ride the spiral to the end and may just go where no-ones been.

Really hard question… Rock being my favorite genre, from indie, experimental to hard and metal, so heres a kinda top 5 (in no particular order): Soda Stereo - Ella Uso Mi Cabeza Como Un Revolver  Radiohead - Just  Red Hot Chili Peppers - Otherside  Soundgarden - Black Hole Sun  Nirvana - Verse Chorus Verse  Sorry for answering with Mainstream Rock, theyre just so good…

The one that’s been consistently my favorite since I first heard it around 2009. Don’t know how it sounds on headphones, but on my 3-way tower speakers, blimey, out of the world! ‘‘If the World’’ by Guns n Roses.

Too many to list. But I am especially fond of Brown Sugar by the Rolling Stones. Yes it’s way politically incorrect, but it rocks. I also love One Bourbon, One Scotch, One Beer by George Thorogood and the Destroyers. I can listen to the entire output of Creedence Clearwater Revival - there’s only a few clunkers in it and they were in their last album.

Wow that’s a tough question. Off the top of my head, Black Hole Sun by Soundgarden is coming to mind. https://youtu.be/9kIv6vVRKpw I’m always transported back to my youth with my brother blasting this album in his room. We listened to this song SO MANY TIMES. It’s just a masterpiece and Chris Cornell is maybe my all time favorite singer.

The question and quest ion details are not extremely clear…Should we consider “Rock” to mean “Rock Music” as in Rock´n´Roll and every subgenres that stemmed from it ? Or “Rock,” which is often used to describe Blues-based, mostly Electric-Guitar driven music ? I´d take to take the second because the first is too vague I´d think. In that case it might very well be “Boys From Nowhere” by the legendary Norwegian band TURBONEGRO. Judge by yourself:  If you did not resent the imminent desire to drive away from this world riding an imaginary nuclear-fueled motorcycle then I don´t think you can truly know what ROCK is. … Or maybe you just have a different taste. Hope this helped!
My favorite rock song is The Beatles’ “I Want to Hold Your Hand.” Just hearing the intro guitar takes me back to a happy place and The Beatles’ 1964 U.S. debut on the Ed Sullivan Show.
My favorite rock song? This one:  It slightly edges out:  And:

Rock is such a broad category. That being said, here’s a few greats. artificial energy-the byrds dead flowers-the stones fake plastic trees-radiohead prisoner-king’s x aneurysm-nirvana dazed and confused-zeppelin living on a thin line-the kinks lots of floyd….run rabbit run. dig that hole in the sun.
QUESTION What is your favourite rock song? Thanks for the A2A!!! Evanescence - Sweet Sacrifice
Lot of songs pop up when it’s about rock music but there is a song that always rock my moment up and i feel the strength and power of it.Here it is: Rockstar-Ali zafar
Stairway to Heaven by Led Zeppellin is among my most favourites and is also one of the greatest rock songs of all time.

ROCK is a big word.. It can be further classified .. in so so so so many ways.. Still m a bit amzed and shocked that no body mentioned QUEEN & NIRWANA Bohemian Rahpsody …(QUEEN) A fusion rock and classical opera music .. No body ever imagined this song will be smash hit Smells like teen spirit(NIRWANA) Birth of grunge rock , koben’s unmatched vocals nd his persona made this a platinum single.. Nobody spoke to a generation the way he did.. Respect to both

I have many favorites but here are a few: Jimi Hendrix Purple Haze 1969 Woodstock Live  Santana - Soul Sacrifice 1969 "Woodstock" Live  (Led Zeppellin)Page & Plant - Kashmir With Egyptian Orchestra / Glastonbury 1995  Enjoy!

My favourite legendary Australian rock song is: ‘Solid Rock’. The song was performed by the Australian band called, ‘Goanna’ and was released in 1982. Here, have a listen to the song in all its glory:   Why not sing along (music with lyrics):  The song epitomses what Australia is really all about!
The nobodies by Marilyn Manson Also the Fall Out Boy is my favorite band during my childhood
Ex’s and Oh’s by Elle King
oui
